item.title: Tomb Raider: Catalyst Officially Announced at The Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
The next chapter for Lara Croft has been revealed at The Game Awards in Tomb Raider: Catalyst. The game, set to release in 2027, brings the iconic archeologist to Northern India to discover ancient secrets.

Released in 1996, the Tomb Raider franchise has become one of the most recognizable video game series ever. Starring the titular Lara Croft, players are taken across the globe in search of archaeological treasures of mystical proportions. From the ruins of Atlantis to the jungles of Paititi, the globetrotting archeologist has been through a lot. Fans have been anxiously awaiting a new entry since 2018’s Shadow of the Tomb Raider, especially after a look at a redone Lara Croft a few years back. Finally, after being teased earlier in the week, Tomb Raider is headed to uncharted territory in a new title.

This story is currently in development and will be updated once more information is available.

Tomb Raider: Catalyst Revealed in New Trailer

In the trailer, which premiered at The Game Awards, fans get a look at the next mainline title, called Tomb Raider: Catalyst. We see Lara Croft battling a mysterious enemy in India. She sports her twin pistols and her signature acrobatic moves. As of now, the game is expected to release in 2027 for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

Tomb Raider Catalyst is one of many of a collaboration between Crystal Dynamics and Amazon, who will publish the game. The media company is also planning a live-action Tomb Raider series, starring Game of Thrones’ Sophie Turner as Lara Croft. It is set to go into development in February 2026. MORE

What do you think of Tomb Raider: Catalyst? Excited to see more? Think it was worth the hype? Any favorite Game Awards reveals so far? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Tomb Raider, check out coverage on a new cast addition to the show and Netflix’s The Legend of Lara Croft. Make sure to subscribe to the weekly newsletter!

item.title: LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight Release Date Announced
item.content:encoded:
The Game Awards 2025 has kicked off with a new release date for LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, with the title arriving on May 29, 2026

LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight was announced earlier this year during Gamescom 2025, and you can check out Insider Gaming’s hands-on preview for the title here. The developers had confirmed that they would be present during The Game Awards, and they really made us feel their presence.

LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight Release in May 2026

Apart from the release date, we also received a new trailer, showcasing new gameplay, playable characters, villains, and more. You can check it out below:

The developers recently revealed that they pulled up references to all Batman movies and TV shows, such as Batman: The Animated Series, The Dark Knight Trilogy, and more. They also read every comic they could get their hands on and had access to the DC Comics archive for this project. From there, they started writing down the key, essential, and iconic moments, which became the starting point for LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight.

The game features a young Bruce Wayne, playing around Wayne Manor, excited to go to the movies with his parents. We then see the character visit the League of Shadows to train and eventually return to Gotham City as the Caped Crusader. You end up making allies with Jim Gordon, Catwoman, Robin, Nightwing, and Batgirl, who are playable characters and come with their specific abilities.

The game will also have you face iconic villains like The Joker, The Penguin, Mr. Freeze, Poison Ivy, Bane, and more, as well as many other gangs of enemies. Players will have access to a new combat system to take these enemies down, which includes combining combos, stealth techniques, and detective skills. Gotham City is also more immersive than ever, featuring crimes, challenges, rewards, secrets, and iconic landmarks such as Arkham Asylum, Ace Chemicals, and Wayne Tower.

In other news, LEGO Batman: Legacy’s open world is larger than the Arkham Knight. Will you be purchasing LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight when it releases? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the world’s first game created 100% through AI with a playable demo. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
